New Records: India won the match by 47 runs.
Afghanistan had not won any of their previous 13 matches against India in any format.
Key Match Events: The match was a high-scoring encounter with India scoring 181/8 and Afghanistan 134/10.
The game was significant in the tournament and had high stakes.
Pre-Game Insights: Afghanistan relied on their bowling attack, particularly Rashid Khan, to challenge India.
India had players like Suryakumar Yadav and Shivam Dube to counter Afghanistan's bowling.
The form of Indian players and their ability to handle Afghanistan's bowling were key.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch conditions were favorable for batting.
The match was Afghanistan's first in the Super Eights.
Others: The weather was not a problem for the match.
